comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Looking north from Cleveland Street across Prince Alfred Park. The old Sydney Railway Terminus is on the left, later expanded across Devonshire Street and the cemetery. "The Exhibition Building in Prince Alfred Park, built in 1870, was once the pride and joy of the City Council. It was used for the annual Agricultural Show and for various exhibitions and public gatherings. By the 1940s there were suggestions that it be used as an indoor swimming pool, but when this option proved too difficult it was demolished in 1954 to make way for an Olympic pool." www.cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au/waterexhibition/images/zoom/a... The "Castlereagh Street" is confusing. At the time what we now call Chalmers Street was called Castlereagh even though there was a gap at Belmore Park. See 1895 street map (interactive) - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0... I would say 1880 - 1890 (from the telegraph pole).

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks for adding this extra detail, beachcomberaustralia. I didn't know that about Chalmers Street. All we usually have to go on is the caption attached to the image.
